TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Math extends Java.Lang.Object
Public NotInheritable Class Math Inherits Object
public ref class Math sealed : Java::Lang::Object

Docs.summary: The class Math contains methods for performing basic numeric operations such as the elementary exponential, logarithm, square root, and trigonometric functions.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public static double Fma (double a, double b, double c);
.method public static hidebysig float64 Fma(float64 a, float64 b, float64 c) cil managed
Public Shared Function Fma (a As Double, b As Double, c As Double) As Double
public: static double Fma(double a, double b, double c);
static member Fma : double * double * double -> double

Docs.summary: Returns the fused multiply add of the three arguments; that is, returns the exact product of the first two arguments summed with the third argument and then rounded once to the nearest double.
Docs.returns: (a × b + c) computed, as if with unlimited range and precision, and rounded once to the nearest double value

format.a: Java documentation for java.lang.Math.fma(double, double, double).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

public: static float Fma(float a, float b, float c);
static member Fma : single * single * single -> single

Docs.summary: Returns the fused multiply add of the three arguments; that is, returns the exact product of the first two arguments summed with the third argument and then rounded once to the nearest float.
Docs.returns: (a × b + c) computed, as if with unlimited range and precision, and rounded once to the nearest float value

format.a: Java documentation for java.lang.Math.fma(float, float, float).
